attributes.action: Award the NHS with the Victoria Cross or the George Cross
attributes.additional_details: To award the NHS the George Cross or the Victoria Cross
attributes.background: To award the NHS the Victoria Cross or the George Cross for gallantry in the presence of the enemy

rejection.details:
We cannot accept petitions that call for specific awards or honours to be given to individuals or organisations, because we can only accept petitions about matters for which the Government or Parliament are responsible.

There is an independent process for considering nominations for awards and honours, including the George Cross and Victoria Cross, and advising the Queen on granting these, so it is not something the Government or Parliament can do.

Information about Civilian gallantry is available here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/civilian-gallantry-operation#the-george-cross-committee

And details of how to nominate someone for an honour or award are available here: https://www.gov.uk/honours/recommend-bravery-award
